page.title: 04STOCK REARING,FEARN.
page.content: As most of the farms in the area are arable or mixed farms, there are no farms relying purely on stock rearing.There are two dairy farms which have about 120 milking cows between them.The milk is collected by tanker daily and sent to Nairn for bottling.Some farms have sheep and cattle.The cattle are wintered indoors.Before 1980 almost all cows calved in October.Nowadays most calve in May which saves on winter feed costs.Though sheep are left out in winter,the ewes are taken inside for lambing.Their winter diet consists of bruised barley with added fishmeal.Lambs over 10 weeks old are sold, the nearest mart being at Dingwall.Fearn Farm has some champion animals.Mascot is the champion bull and Petal the champion cow. They have champion Clune and Charollais sheep.
